Name: arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy
Definition: An intrinsic cardiomyopathy that is characterized by hypokinetic areas involving the free wall of the right ventricle

Name: left ventricular noncompaction
Definition: An intrinsic cardiomyopathy characterized by distinctive (spongy) morphological appearance of the LV myocardium.

Name: infantile histiocytoid cardiomyopathy
Definition: An intrinsic cardiomyopathy characterized by the presence of characteristic pale granular foamy histiocyte-like cells within the myocardium and has_material_basis_in a mutation in the gene encoding mitochondrial cytochrome b.

Name: hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
Definition: An intrinsic cardiomyopathy that is characterized by abnormal  thickening (hypertrophy) of the heart without any obvious cause.

Name: obsolete anorectal gonorrhea
Definition: An intrinsic cardiomyopathy that is characterized by abnormal  thickening (hypertrophy) of the heart without any obvious cause.

Name: dilated cardiomyopathy
Definition: An intrinsic cardiomyopathy that is characterized by an an enlarged heart and damage to the myocardium causing the heart to pump blood inefficiently.

Name: long QT syndrome
Definition: An autosomal genetic disease that is characterized by delayed repolarization of the heart following a heartbeat increases the risk of episodes of torsade de pointes (TDP

Name: restrictive cardiomyopathy
Definition: A differentiated thyroid gland carcinoma that is characterized by the small mushroom shape of the tumor which has a stem attached to the epithelial layer abd arises from the follicular cells of the thyroid gland.
